page.title: 16LIFESTYLE IN PETROCKSTOWE
page.content: Most homes in{Petrockstowe}have a life style that reflects the rural farming community - main meals are generally taken at midday or from 4.30 to 6 pm, cooked variously by electricity or on an oil-fired or solid fuel Rayburn or Aga, which usually also provides some form of central heating. Milk is deli- vered 3 times a week to most houses & half have bread,meat & fish deliveries also. 75% of the houses have a freezer & freeze vegetables & fruit plus some bulk meat & cooked foods. Main{shop- {ping}is generally done{weekly}by car in{Torrington}or{Hatherleigh}with {monthly}trips to{Bideford & Barnstaple for bigger supermarkets, but most people use the village Post Office & Store weekly, where they can also collect their pensions & allowances. Tankers deliver heating oil & LPG and both wood & coal merchants deliver.
